COP3223K - Honors Introduction to Progra.name: COP3223K - Honors Introduction to Programming with C

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Consent of Honors and one of the following: COP 2500C with a "C" (2.0) or better, or Appropriate score on the UCF CS Placement Exam, or Consent of Instructor.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Programming with C including arrays, pointer manipulation and use of standard C math and IO libraries.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Design and development of assemblers, linkers, loaders, and compilers. Study memory hierarchy, program performance, and system level I/O.

Prerequisites.text: Permission of Honors and (COP 3502H or COP 3502C) and COP 3330 and (MAD 2104 or COT 3100C) each with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Algorithm design and analysis for tree, list, set, and graph data models; algorithmic strategies and applications, and algorithmic complexity analysis; sorting and searching; practical applications. With honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Paradigms and fundamental concepts of programming languages are presented, including: scope, binding, abstraction, encapsulation, typing etc. Design paradigms object-oriented, functional and logic programming are presented.
